zone.line: ey eyes but it continually gave place to distraction
The sun sunk lower in the heavens; we
passed the river Drance and observed its path
through the chasms of the higher and the glens
of the lower hills. The Ap Alps here come closer
to the lake and we approached the amphi-
thre theatre of mountains which forms the
eastern boundary of the lake. The spire of Evian
shone un t d e under the woods that surrounded
it and the range of mountain above mountain
The wind which had hitherto carried us a-
long with amazing rapidity sunk at sunset to a
